channel.title: Kernel Panic macOS Monterey 12.0.1 and VirtualBox 6.1.26 or 6.1.28
channel.description:
I try to start Whonix on macOS Monterey 12.0.1 and VirtualBox. When I start the gateway, I get a kernel panic. And when I use version 6.1.26 of VirtualBox, I get a kernel panic and the computer freezes and restarts.
Can someone please help me with this?
Thank you

item.title: Kernel Panic macOS Monterey 12.0.1 and VirtualBox 6.1.26 or 6.1.28
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Wiki page…

Whonix – 26 Oct 21

Whonix ™ in VirtualBox - Troubleshooting - Whonix ™ does not Start?

VT-x is disabled in the BIOS. / VERR_VMX_MSR_VMXON_DISABLED / VERR_SSM_FIELD_NOT_CONSECUTIVE / supR3HardenedWinReSpawn / Enable VT-x in BIOS / Aborted Status / Guru Mediation

mentions “use Debian stable as a host operating system”… Not sure that is helpful. That would be an indirect fix but of course most users aren’t eager to change their host operating system.

Check General VirtualBox Troubleshooting Steps anyhow.

SolidRhino:

Can someone please help me with this?

Highly unlikely.

SolidRhino:

And when I use version 6.1.26 of VirtualBox, I get a kernel panic and the computer freezes and restarts.

See: Host Crash

Read full topic
item.source: Kernel Panic macOS Monterey 12.0.1 and VirtualBox 6.1.26 or 6.1.28
